hanzi-su-wiki:
籍

Значения

Прописка, регистрация, книга

Мнемоника

Внизу — напоминание о том, что в 昔 древности в первым пахоту начинал, встав за плуг 耒, сам император. Значения: «ссылаться, опираться, пользоваться случаем». Вместе — записи на бамбуковых 竹 дощечках, используемые для управления страной, книги регистрации населения.
purpleculture_pinyin:
jí
book or record; registry; roll; place of one's family or ancestral records; membership
книга или запись; реестр; рулон; место записи семьи или предков; членство
rtega_mnemonic:
籍籍RSrecord, register, list, census, membership
  • plow 耤 tracks into bamboo 竹 to record someone's membership
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 耤 indicates the sound; ⺮ (bamboo) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
书籍 [ shū jí ]: books; works
户籍 [ hù jí ]: census register; household register
外籍 [ wài jí ]: foreign (i.e. of foreign nationality)
古籍 [ gǔ jí ]: ancient text; antique books
党籍 [ dǎng jí ]: party membership
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • ⺮ [ zhú ] bamboo; flute
    • 耤 [ jí ] to plow; to rely on
heisig_chinese_memo: In times past, in order to enroll in a Christian school you had to answer a series of questions to ensure that your records as a Christian are true. For example, the principal might show you a picture of a Christmas tree and a picture of some bamboo and ask you which one is most suitable for decoration at Christmas time.
heisig_constituent: enroll, bamboo, christmas tree, wood, once upon a time, storyteller
heisig_story: Bamboo . . . Christmas tree . . . once upon a time.
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: Записаться, регистр по месту жительства, членство
koohiiStory1: Japanese father enrolls his student in a well-rounded school: they teach eastern traditions (the way of the bamboo), western traditions (like Christmas trees), and also teach literature (once upon a time).
koohiiStory2: Once upon a time, in order to enroll in a Christian school you had to answer a series of questions to ensure that you were really Christian. For example, the principal might show you a picture of a Christmas tree and a picture of some bamboo and ask you which one is most suitable for decoration at Christmas time.
jp_example_words:
戸籍(こせき): census, family register
国籍(こくせき): nationality
書籍(しょせき): book, publication
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: People had to ride their bamboo plows long ago to enroll in things. There were no cars yet, so they would hitch a cow to their bamboo plow, and dig their way to the government office or school to enroll.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the little hut that passed for school long ago. All of the bamboo plows are parked around it, as the people enroll themselves and their kids up for classes.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you enroll in something new people will find you very sexy (せき). This was true long ago too. There's nothing sexier than trying to improve yourself.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture a line of people enrolling for new classes, sports, citizenship, etc. The moment they've enrolled they poof into the perfect, sexy person (in your eyes).
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 昔 (むかし、セキ、シャク давно, в прошлом).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 亠 (крышка), ハ, 土 (земля), 日 (день), 木 (дерево), 竹 (бамбук), 耒 (лопата)
Ru_trainchinese: jí: (сущ) запись, книга; место рождения; принадлежность, членство
Kanshudo_mnemonic: where you've plowed (耒) since ancient (昔) times is in the bamboo (⺮) register
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In times past, in order to enroll in a Christian school you had to answer a series of questions to ensure that your records as a Christian are true. For example, the principal might show you a picture of a Christmas tree and a picture of some bamboo and ask you which one is most suitable for decoration at Christmas time.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "艸" to "耤" sound. The original meaning is an archive book that records household registration and taxes in ancient times. "Said Wen": "Books, books and books. From bamboo, sound." "Shi Ming. "Shishuqi": "Registration, registration, so the name of Tong's household registration." Such as "Zhou Li. Autumn lawsuit Kou. "Xiao Xingren": "Xiao Xingren holds the ceremonies of the guests of the country, waiting for the envoys of the Quartet." "Lun Heng. "Zi Ji": "There are many houses for husbands, and the land must not be small; if you have a large number of households, you must have a lot of books."

" Ji " by extension means books, books. Such as "Historical Records. "Biography of Boyi": "The husband and scholar's book is extremely rich, but the letter is still in Liuling." "Han Shu. "Arts and Literature History": "Han Xing, to change the defeat of Qin, to collect the books, broaden the road of book offering."

" Membership " means records, registration. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. Second Year of Chenggong": "Wang Yi Gong Bo feast, and privately bribed it. The messenger said: "Indecent assault, do not register!"" Du pre-note: "Ji, Shu Ye." "Han Shu. "Gao Di Ji": "I entered the customs, Qiu Hao dare not take it, the local staff, the mansion treasury, waiting for the general." Yan Shi Gu's note: "Ji means a book."

"Ji mei" is an ancient criminal law, which means registration and confiscation of all property. It can be called " Ji " in the province. Such as "Historical Records. "The Book of the First Emperor of Qin": "Since now, those who are innocent in state affairs are like lesbians, and those who are inadequate are based on their own." "Governing the Family": "Following the law, taking advantage of his family property, a house of hemp shoes, a library of clothes, and other treasures are beyond words."

" Ji " can specifically refer to a door, a sign with a name and identity. In the Han Dynasty, anyone who needed to enter or leave the palace gate had to hang the county of their home country on the palace gate for inspection. "Zhengzitong. "Bamboo Department": "Registration, family status, set a record at the door, and enter and exit by case." "Historical Records. Biography of Wei Qiwu Anhou Hou: "Except for Dou Yingmen, the Queen Mother is not allowed to enter the court." "Han Shu. "Emperor Yuan Dynasty": "Anyone who orders from the official to give the palace Sima Zhong must be the eldest parents, parents and brothers." Look for the palace gates of the county, and the provinces correspond to each other, so you can gain entry."

" Ji " means " borrow ", which can mean relying on it. Such as "Han Feizi. "Five beetles": "It is the custom of the old and chaotic country, and its scholars claim that the way of the first king is introduced by the book, and the law of the world is suspicious, and the heart of the second person is the foreground." . Such as "Salt Iron Theory. "Special Road": "The husband reminisces about the ancient ways, and the book "Poetry" and "Book" on the pillow, danger cannot be settled, disorder cannot be cured.
humanum_short_description_en: From "艸", "耤" sound. The original meaning is an archive book that records household registration and taxes in ancient times.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「耤」聲。本義是古代記錄戶口、賦稅等的檔案簿書。《說文》：「籍，簿書也。从竹，耤聲。」《釋名．釋書契》：「籍，籍也，所以籍䟽人名戶口也。」如《周禮．秋官司寇．小行人》：「小行人掌邦國賓客之禮籍，以待四方之使者。」《論衡．自紀》：「夫宅舍多，土地不得小；戶口眾，簿籍不得少。」

　　「籍」引申表示書冊、書籍。如《史記．伯夷列傳》：「夫學者載籍極博，猶考信於六蓺。」《漢書．藝文志》：「漢興，改秦之敗，大收篇籍，廣開獻書之路。」

　　「籍」表示記錄、登記。如《左傳．成公二年》：「王以鞏伯宴，而私賄之。使相告之曰：『非禮也，勿籍！』」杜預注：「籍，書也。」《漢書．高帝紀》：「吾入關，秋豪無所敢取，籍吏民，封府庫，待將軍。」顏師古注：「籍，謂為簿籍。」

　　「籍沒」是古代一種刑法，意謂登記沒收所有財產，可省稱「籍」。如《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「自今以來，操國事不道如嫪毐、不韋者籍其門，視此。」司馬貞索隱：「謂籍沒其一門皆為徒隸。」《顏氏家訓．治家》：「後坐事伏法，籍其家產，麻鞋一屋，弊衣數庫，其餘財寶不可勝言。」

　　「籍」可特指門籍，一種寫有姓名、身分的牌子。漢代時，凡有事需出入宮門者需把門籍縣掛在宮門，以備查驗。《正字通．竹部》：「籍，門籍，置牒于門，以案出入也。」《史記．魏其武安侯列傳》：「太后除竇嬰門籍，不得入朝請。」《漢書．元帝紀》：「令從官給事宮司馬中者，得為大父母父母兄弟通籍。」顏師古注引應劭曰：「籍者，為二尺竹牒，記其年紀、名字、物色，縣之宮門，案省相應，乃得入也。」

　　「籍」通「藉」，可表示憑借。如《韓非子．五蠹》：「是故亂國之俗，其學者則稱先王之道以籍介義，盛容服而飾辯說，以疑當世之法，而貳人主之心。」又表示鋪墊。如《鹽鐵論．殊路》：「夫重懷古道，枕籍《詩》《書》，危不能安，亂不能治。」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「耤」聲。本義是古代記錄戶口、賦稅等的檔案簿書。

從「 艸 」，「 耤 」聲。本義是古代記錄戶口、賦稅等的檔案簿書。《說文》：「籍，簿書也。从竹，耤聲。」《釋名．釋書契》：「籍，籍也，所以籍䟽人名戶口也。」如《周禮．秋官司寇．小行人》：「小行人掌邦國賓客之禮籍，以待四方之使者。」《論衡．自紀》：「夫宅舍多，土地不得小；戶口眾，簿籍不得少。」 「 籍 」引申表示書冊、書籍。如《史記．伯夷列傳》：「夫學者載籍極博，猶考信於六蓺。」《漢書．藝文志》：「漢興，改秦之敗，大收篇籍，廣開獻書之路。」 「 籍 」表示記錄、登記。如《左傳．成公二年》：「王以鞏伯宴，而私賄之。使相告之曰：『非禮也，勿籍！』」杜預注：「籍，書也。」《漢書．高帝紀》：「吾入關，秋豪無所敢取，籍吏民，封府庫，待將軍。」顏師古注：「籍，謂為簿籍。」 「籍沒」是古代一種刑法，意謂登記沒收所有財產，可省稱「 籍 」。如《史記．秦始皇本紀》：「自今以來，操國事不道如嫪毐、不韋者籍其門，視此。」司馬貞索隱：「謂籍沒其一門皆為徒隸。」《顏氏家訓．治家》：「後坐事伏法，籍其家產，麻鞋一屋，弊衣數庫，其餘財寶不可勝言。」 「 籍 」可特指門籍，一種寫有姓名、身分的牌子。漢代時，凡有事需出入宮門者需把門籍縣掛在宮門，以備查驗。《正字通．竹部》：「籍，門籍，置牒于門，以案出入也。」《史記．魏其武安侯列傳》：「太后除竇嬰門籍，不得入朝請。」《漢書．元帝紀》：「令從官給事宮司馬中者，得為大父母父母兄弟通籍。」顏師古注引應劭曰：「籍者，為二尺竹牒，記其年紀、名字、物色，縣之宮門，案省相應，乃得入也。」 「 籍 」通「 藉 」，可表示憑借。如《韓非子．五蠹》：「是故亂國之俗，其學者則稱先王之道以籍介義，盛容服而飾辯說，以疑當世之法，而貳人主之心。」又表示鋪墊。如《鹽鐵論．殊路》：「夫重懷古道，枕籍《詩》《書》，危不能安，亂不能治。」

籍字的基本解释

籍
jí
书，书册：古籍。书籍。经籍。典籍。
登记隶属关系的簿册；隶属关系：籍贯。户籍。国籍。学籍。

尺籍 большая дощечка для письма
文籍 книги, литературные памятники
2) список, реестр
司籍 ведать реестрами, вести списки
名籍 именной список, реестр
3) место приписки, принадлежность, происхождение, гражданство, подданство
原籍 место происхождения (приписки рода)
外籍人 иностранный подданный
4) подушный налог; повинность
租籍 рента и подушный налог; подушные налоги и повинности
5) парадная (восточная) лестница
6) стар., рит. поле, вспахиваемое императором
II гл.
1) писать, записывать
非礼勿籍 не записывать того, что не соответствует этикету
2) вносить в кадастровые (фискальные) списки; облагать налогами
籍求 затребовать в счёт уплаты налогов
3) описывать (имущество)
籍其财产 описать его (их) имущество
4) топтать, попирать; исхаживать вдоль и поперёк
籍于田而耕之 вспахать поле, исходив его вдоль и поперёк, обработать своим горбом
5) jiè * опираться, полагаться, ссылаться (на что-л.)
由是文字籍生焉 таким образом отсюда и произошли письмена
6) jiè подстилать, подкладывать (под себя)
枕经籍书 подкладывать вместо подушки канон, вместо подстилки — книги (обр. в знач.: упорно заниматься)
III собств.
Цзи (фамилия)
Radicals: 竹, 耒, 昔  (bamboo, plow, long-ago)
Meaning Mnemonic
People had to ride their bamboo plows long ago to enroll in things. There were no cars yet, so they would hitch a cow to their bamboo plow, and dig their way to the government office or school to enroll.
Picture the little hut that passed for school long ago. All of the bamboo plows are parked around it, as the people enroll themselves and their kids up for classes.
Reading Mnemonic
If you enroll in something new people will find you very sexy (せき). This was true long ago too. There's nothing sexier than trying to improve yourself.
Picture a line of people enrolling for new classes, sports, citizenship, etc. The moment they've enrolled they poof into the perfect, sexy person (in your eyes).
